title: Grade 6
subject: College and Career Ready Standards for Literacy (CCRSL) (2017-)

0801E80BC5BA431B880BDDC1D7E66043.description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

DEF37A4E44F047C3AE82BCC76B5AB6A7.description: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

F2744136E8E543818F355C9CA3716AC0.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to better understand each of the words.

04D5F95B112F41358CA93DFA07BB3CCF.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification) in context.

0AD4CC154496491790032647FCA0C025.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

7FA426170C504655A0624CFF885A5E90.description: Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

94CAE2A1C684406F8DE7D0338463B807.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

AF9C6F0287F5441EAA4726829011D055.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).

A1334E4C49A74908AF28938BDD6C53EE.description: Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

07521E9F70DE43369161D6561E172EE3.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple- meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

F3694C4C5D644B418B7D39B5B01A7ED6.description: Maintain consistency in style and tone.

10BEA64B3B774289B16D9BE836C0606D.description: Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

5196FAF35720437FB59C50E572B0D6BD.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

50ED525368704547B7FC5BDF22F34AB4.description: Use punctuation (commas, parentheses, dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.

C9FA6289633A474AB8EA193D83E6FE4F.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

CBEF0CF9609B4332896A63A07EE4FF27.description: Recognize variations from standard English in their own and others' writing and speaking, and identify and use strategies to improve expression in conventional language.

D388DFE23B974C3381721B37B938A3A2.description: Recognize and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or ambiguous antecedents).

C50D21D175E24B22810E59C955B21F45.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person.

C32D9307E36E45A683F7ADCD3C1F3CC8.description: Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive).

FAB3AFB21A7241E3A73D57DA11BA607C.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

145EA34285BB44688E1712B22311C963.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate. (See grade 6 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

FE1BEECFBD5144999625CC38F0372A48.description: Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, images, music, sound) and visual displays in presentations to clarify information.

C8E4B864E16F48FCA1960A1E8A52AC9B.description: Present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically and using pertinent descriptions, facts, and details to accentuate main ideas or themes; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

656B21E1F7CF4C2D99103B6F384C15C1.description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

7F05CD5B9129443DA1A6075EBBCAFCFA.description: Interpret information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain how it contributes to a topic, text, or issue under study.

508980E291E04A25AA317C8109423AC6.description: Review the key ideas expressed and demonstrate understanding of multiple perspectives through reflection and paraphrasing.

BAEE8B78A61742A2BDF69E2781A4A070.description: Pose and respond to specific questions with elaboration and detail by making comments that contribute to the topic, text, or issue under discussion.

697BF8FBB9304F66A5320ACEA9E1EE07.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions, set specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

2175DB96446E418FB8786F324DE064B8.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

6D961DBDF227442BB8F5DBB2365477A1.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 6 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

4CE1BF860276454B89708237BEB71ED0.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

0DE56D4E38C2470381E88F765C1796E2.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
a. Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres [e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories] in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.").
b. Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., "Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.").

F4B38A14A531475BBFC8C44DD59DBD4E.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

09303E8E0FD745E8BC0F0EEFF58EC56F.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and refocusing the inquiry when appropriate.

DA7026E29A354AFB8C1FEE1B8120BD9B.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

5FAA0C0DB4A14CB18F1316AA4AF69EB0.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting.

CA53AACBFFDF409BB26C3FB8FDDF6A01.description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grade 6.)

82718D8C32A14763A96A2426A2CBD2AF.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3.)

A9839DD875014952933B1A036F01E00C.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

A99350DC3114444494AF7B6284000110.description: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events.

856D8319808F4B118EB968AA04598A5C.description: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

8F8F6AC2F35E4193862467F0D38DC7EF.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

3112F13DF52F4CC997416AD3FBE7C2F4.description:
Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context
and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an
event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

D63A3EB828BF4D15A982B7B7CC79ADC5.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or
events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details,
and well-structured event sequences.

45C13B639AEF431597C6E91C457E6987.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation presented.

924A035614CE43AC8C7241C9029008F9.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

EF8E74AB13064A25AC4FC3979513B628.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

4969E7A18DFF499F8B01694CF06709D0.description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

7343A06AD99949DB99C4790BF55CE00A.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

7DA9B7BBE4B14230931071E41DCB2748.description: Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

149A621B5CEC4196A966BAEC57B8A3C4.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

CB694D0B2E0A43499DE60D81BA1CD023.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the argument presented.

C0807FDDBA864609BC423A21CD9BD175.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

0C0DEF75809A4D599E582AA1E639B43D.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among claim(s) and reasons.

E45ECDD9568F462796450E2F300847EF.description: Support claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence, using credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

2C4FCBA5716B4EE7AAFA5653F7400322.description: Introduce claim(s) and organize the reasons and evidence clearly.

A3B9753651104C71B485F68DA0B44CA5.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

8F4C8B8FCC6D46D2AE313A53D4ABD17F.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

4ED8310956534F278562978538E5F382.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

EE1A8F2026A645CF8D9478921BE96E8F.description: Compare and contrast one author's presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on the same person) concepts.

2A83EC0414634584BD9D625B6BCF7CE1.description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

50C2697DBE764B4F9D965CF83126344C.description: Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

FC127D7AD33448F9928CDABD7B372304.description:
Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text
and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

716DF838791548EBB3AC8C8004190713.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

3A771D2B77144B5084B2BEF9E9ADE187.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and
technical meanings.

05B408EC18BA4DEEBB4AA0F7C8E4FBE0.description: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

879232E0E51948D084B3DB28EB758F38.description: Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

678DEC95269647498901A3FF77712C74.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

E85A7C85F3A04D05811C4E49BEC89E00.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 6–8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

248FAB8B13D8454F863AA2C9D05DD6BA.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

322B8A67E2D840E188C9F12908BDC5C6.description: Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

C3B69E826DB54306A0D8FB60CCCCCD62.description: Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text, including contrasting what they “see” and “hear” when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

80D844C5DFB24698BA0476A2AA609C31.description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

5B5A7598DA424D58AFFA34F036FD625C.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

CB25C7318C9D4DA7B159B047BB9AB993.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

0D32CEC6EEC54EC0921CF5DB293E5EA6.description: Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

BF957ACA28664CA1AD32D1CD6DDF3C6A.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

4A8155A239A043998C54D25BDCE2F846.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.
